ygData.subject: Invalid URIs and URL records
ygData.msgSnippet: While processing the results of a crawl with libarc, I came across an ARC record that contains a URL record that is invalid: it contains embedded spaces

Subject: Invalid URIs and URL records

X-Yahoo-Profile: tree02139

While processing the results of a crawl with libarc, I came across an
ARC record that contains a URL record that is invalid: it contains
embedded spaces (U+0020). The grammar for URL-record-v1 is given at

       http://www.archive.org/web/researcher/ArcFileFormat.php

is

URL-record-v1 == <url><sp>
<ip-address><sp>
<archive-date><sp>
<content-type><sp>
<length><nl> 

Obviously a <url> that contains a space will cause my parser to choke.

I'm not sure the best way to address this. My first thought is to
modify ARCWriterProcessor#writeHttp to call java.net.URLEncoder.encode
on the the CrawlURI.

Thoughts?

    -tree

P.S. The URL record is:

http://ti.um.u-tokyo.ac.jp/FMPro?-db=him%5fscientific%5fname&-format=gen%5fresults.htm&-lay=search&SEARCH%5fFAMGENFRG=1&-op=eq&FAM=[FMP-FIELD: SEARCH_FAM]&-max=20&-skip=0&-Token.1=[FMP-CurrentToken:1]&-token.2=[FMP-CurrentToken:2]&-token.3=[FMP-CURRENTFIND][FMP-FINDVALUEITEM: HTML][/FMP-CURRENTFIND]&-Token.4=[FMP-CurrentToken:4]&-find= 133.11.109.190 20040813160545 text/html 3670
